DOC.brief_summary: Study evaluates the efficacy and tolerability of low volume preparations compared with conventional 4L polyethylene glycol prior to colonoscopy
DOC.brief_title: Polyethylene Glycol Versus Low Volume Solutions Prior to Colonoscopy
DOC.detailed_description: To compare the efficacy and tolerance of standard polyethylene glycol to low volume sodium picosulphate/magnesium citrate and polyethylene glycol/ascorbic acid in a single or split dose regimen for colonoscopy bowel preparation in a head-to-head design.
DOC.criteria: Subjects referred to diagnostic or therapeutic colonoscopy ileus known or suspected bowel obstruction active bowel inflammation pregnancy any presence of serious medical conditions history of prior colonic or rectal surgery inability to obtain valid data from subject
